text:
Four-time cable car bell ringing champion Leonard Oats performs on the turntable at Powell and Market streets in San Francisco. Muni is rolling a cable car onto the Powell turntable three days a week for photo ops and for a scene of normalcy.

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mike Yastrzemski emerged as one of the Giants' best players amid oversized expectations wrought by his surname. It was fitting that he won the 2020 Willie Mac Award in balloting by teammates, coaches, trainers and fans.

https://t.co/wxQ8ccMMZZ

name: sfchronicle
text:
With the postseason beginning next week, the A‚Äôs are at pretty much their worst, playing some lousy baseball lately, writes @SusanSlusser ‚Äî particularly in dropping both halves of a doubleheader Saturday at the Coliseum.

name: sfchronicle
text: SB932 will mandate that health workers ask patients infected with the coronavirus and about 90 other diseases about their sexual orientation and gender identity. Patients could decline to answer. https://t.co/YbRvGnvm9F

text:

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Will the Giants be in or out of this year's playoffs? @HankSchulman summarizes all the simple and crazy scenarios that can take place this Sunday to decide the team's playoff fate. https://t.co/ew6Ekzcgjm

name: sfchronicle
text:
Stanford researchers reveal the "hidden cost" of wildfire smoke: Up to 3,000 deaths in the state have been caused by air pollution between Aug 1. and Sept. 10.
https://t.co/7SdWiwDWJ0

name: sfchronicle
text:
Pollution from an unprecedented stretch of heavy wildfire smoke is likely to have led to up to 3,000, deaths in California between Aug 1. and Sept. 10, according to a Sanford study.
https://t.co/UgsZrvvlMn
